title: Jennifer Walters
author: Jennifer Walters
content: This little guy caught with a backpack of crystal meth. I wonder if it was his day job or was just helping a pal get through some tough times  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2h55HOACl_A

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Pigeons are really smart animals, they can be trained really well. Some people race them over long distances for sport. This kind of thing happens all the time, it’s a good way for criminals to get drugs into maximum security prisons. Weirdly the drug trade is big even in jail & obviously it’s tough to smuggle drugs in. Our feathered friends are obviously very useful to these guys. I just hope they get fed well & looked after.

comments.author: geeyow
comments.body: Quote from: Jennifer Walters on January 13, 2023, 08:03:49 PMThis little guy caught with a backpack of crystal meth. I wonder if it was his day job or was just helping a pal get through some tough times  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2h55HOACl_AReading this news makes me think about Will Smith's animated movie with Tom Holland (Spies in Disguise) wherein he was a top class super spy who got turned into a pigeon. LMAO Any chance the pigeon was actually a super spy? or in this case super junkie?

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: I heard some prisons have their own birds of prey to hunt down these birds of noobs, lol.

comments.author: bitterguy28
comments.body: Quote from: Jennifer Walters on January 13, 2023, 08:03:49 PMThis little guy caught with a backpack of crystal meth. I wonder if it was his day job or was just helping a pal get through some tough times  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2h55HOACl_Aare you new in you tube? there are already something similar even in the past that pigeon had been used to smuggle drugs of any kind inside Jail or prisons.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: How can we smuggle in drugs to a prison? This question just has endless possibilities. I could not stop laughing, a pigeon caught smuggling crystal meth in a prison. Drug smuggling gone Harry Potter style; with this inmate has a pigeon rather than a phoenix. What a well thought out plan, however the pigeon probably lacked more training to get to its owner that right way. I can't even stop laughing at the fact that the guards had to set up traps to catch the pigeon. Now that is a show for the prisoners. I just hope that Bird does get compensated for his work, he made it his destination, now that the inmate should have been there.
